title: [CFD-1] Amount of Kangals to hold to be able to create visible proposals
body:
The result of this vote will establish the minimum amount of Kangals required to hold to be able to create proposals that will be visible on the community tab of Kangal’s snapshot spaces.

Summary

Snapshot platform allows us to set a minimum score for the number of tokens needed to hold to be able to create a visible proposal. Since Kangal is community-owned, it makes sense for the community to decide on this limit.

In this vote, we propose to make the starting minimum option 5M Kangals to avoid spam submissions.

Do not forget that proposals need to first go through the discussion on the community forum and should have an implementable structure.

Voting

This proposal will be created on both (ETH) and (BSC) spaces. The result will be finalized by tallying up the votes on both sides.

Voting will take place between 16 March and 19 March.

To be able to vote, participants should be holding Kangal in their wallets since the snapshot block number of the proposal.

Voting power is directly related to the Kangal balance of a wallet, 1 KANGAL/bKANGAL equals to 1 vote.

Options

Option 1: 5M
Option 2: 10M
Option 3: 20M
Option 4: 50M
Option 5: 100M
Option 6: 250M
Option 7: 500M

Notes
CFD: Community Foundation Document
author: 0x63c67Ba2aa323e47eddDB3952990CF41768a679c
